item.title: Evelus
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:9, topic:421172”][quote author=Codeusa12 link=topic=523837.msg3811368#msg3811368 date=1320960553]
If anyone wants the source code let me know, he forgot to take me off the drop box lol
[/quote]
IIRC they are different drop box’s. Although you do have some of the code, just not up to date.[/quote]

Some people do have some bits of the code but I am (I think) the only one with access to our security development folder. What you did get you can keep, you did pay for it!

Emp has finished a plugin system, not entirely sure how it works just yet since we develop separate from one another.

In security news, CEU is done. Archiver is being written as we speak.

Read full topic

item.title: Evelus
item.dc:creator: @WW1 WW
item.description:
@WW1 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:4, topic:421172”][quote author=WW link=topic=523837.msg3811024#msg3811024 date=1320908330]
That’s a very nice look and feel mate; but will it run fine on an average computer?
[/quote]

It should, before the application is ran your computer is benched marked to assure that everything runs smoothly (The library that we use at the moment is SIGAR, if you needed that). That doesn’t guarantee that, but at the moment my worries are about comparability since we have to build libraries for different OS’ and their archs.

In terms of graphics running smoothly, the background framework has the ability to control the cycle rate at which the graphics are updated and divides the screen into containers so that each can be updated accordingly.[/quote]A common problem releasing something for multiple operating systems - but if your hearts in it you will finish it with relatively no struggle. Support and good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Evelus
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

WW:

That’s a very nice look and feel mate; but will it run fine on an average computer?

It should, before the application is ran your computer is benched marked to assure that everything runs smoothly (The library that we use at the moment is SIGAR, if you needed that). That doesn’t guarantee that, but at the moment my worries are about comparability since we have to build libraries for different OS’ and their archs.

In terms of graphics running smoothly, the background framework has the ability to control the cycle rate at which the graphics are updated and divides the screen into containers so that each can be updated accordingly.

Read full topic
